newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech PX50 and RPIX indices close higher.
newsitem.headline: Czech PX50 and RPIX indices close higher.

text.p: The Czech PX50 index closed higher on Tuesday led by the four most heavily capitalised shares on the Prague Stock Exchange (PSE) which all rose.
SPT Telecom again led the way with a 37 crown gain to 3,128 but dealers said domestic investors had been responsible for most of the buying with foreigners staying on the sidelines.
"I haven't seen much demand from outside the country. Its mainly domestic buying," said Lubomir Vystavel of ING Barings.
Foreign investors have been put off the Czech equities market because of fears over the lack of regulation in the capital markets.

The Czech government at the weekend said it would take steps to improve the situation early next year and the PSE has said it will try to set up a US style securities watchdog perhaps as early as next July.
Other major issues also rose. CEZ gained five crowns to 977, Komercni Banka rose 11 crowns to 2,091 and Ceska Sporitelna was up three crowns to 316.
In the broader market, glass fibre maker Vertex resumed its sharply downward course with a 159 crown fall to 3,041.
